Package it.polimi.se2019.model.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.model.board.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains tiles and keeps track of:
  • killShotRewards
  • Skulls
  • Ammos and Weapons and PowerUps deck

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Board.Builder
      Builder class to build Board

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Deck<AmmoCard> ammoCards
      List of possible ammos to randomly appear on non-spawn Tiles
      private java.util.List<Door> doors
      Adjacency list of doors between tiles
      private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> killShotReward
      List of possible rewards for killShot
      private java.util.List<Player> killShotTrack
      List of players that got a Kill and an Overkill Every kill is composed by two elements added to the list: Player who gave the KillShot Player who gave the OverKill; null gets added if no overkill.
      private java.lang.String name  
      private int originalSkulls
      Number of skulls at the start of the match
      private Deck<PowerUp> powerUps
      List of powerUps to randomly draw
      private int skulls
      Number of skulls remaining on the Board
      private java.util.List<java.util.List<Tile>> tiles
      List of tiles that make up the Board
      private Deck<Weapon> weaponsDeck
      Deck containing the remaining weapons

    • isLinked

      public boolean isLinked​(Tile tile1,
                        Tile tile2,
                        boolean throughWalls)
      Check if two tiles are linked by:
    • A door
    • Being in the same room and having distance 1
      • Parameters:
      tile1 - first tile
      tile2 - second tile
      Returns:
      true if the tiles are connected

    • visibleTiles

      public java.util.Set<Tile> visibleTiles​(Tile pointOfView)
      Visible tiles by the pointOfView All tiles that are or in the same room, or in the same room of a tile connected by a Door to POV are visibleTiles
      Parameters:
      pointOfView - square used to calculate visibility
      Returns:
      a set containing visibleTiles tiles

    • reachable

      public java.util.Set<Tile> reachable​(Tile pointOfView,
                                     int minDistance,
                                     int maxDistance,
                                     boolean throughWalls)
      Get the reachable tiles given a starting Tile, without going through walls
      Parameters:
      pointOfView - starting Tile
      minDistance - minimum distance that can be reached
      maxDistance - maximum distance that can be reached
      Returns:
      set of tiles that can be reached
